instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keeps blowing backlight enable resistors
threads.message: Has anyone had this issue where <RESISTOR>R7715</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR> keep blowing? The resistance to ground is good on all the pads. I replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. No change. Not sure why, but it looks like there's a surge coming into <RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR>. Or something is happening on the other end through <RESISTOR>R7715</RESISTOR> and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. Board is otherwise functional.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keeps blowing backlight enable resistors
threads.message:
With the voltages present on the board it is 100% impossible to blow these resistors. Why do you think they are dead?
You could do some basic math and calculate wattage with the voltage present and resistance. P=V^2/R. 0201 resistor is typically 0.05W.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keeps blowing backlight enable resistors
threads.message: I love a good riddle, but I can't think of anything else that could be happening besides my initial two guesses. I'm measuring no shorts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keeps blowing backlight enable resistors
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>? Again it is impossible to kill them!
